header: bin is a file system management software that is designed for people who do not use 'git' or do not know how to code. bin is a very useful tool for organizing tracking files that have been modified or deleted from the bin container or current working directory.

open.description: opens the GUI appliction for bin container depending on the directory you are in.

commands.open <file name || folder name>: opens the file and shows the content of the file; opens folder in the GUI application.

-l.description: list all the items in your bin and list files or other sub-directoires in the folder.

this list all the items in the bin container in your bin.
commands.-l <folder name>: see a list of items in a certain directroy path in your bin container or directories on local computer.

add.description: adds files to staging area to be pushed to bin.

adding everything in the loacl directory bin is currently in.
commands.<file || folder>: addes cretian items to your bin container.

stat.description: gives status report about the your bin.

commands.-n: all nes files or folders add to the current working directory your bin container is located.
commands.-bc: displays the number of items in your bin container.
commands.-f: all the fiolders in your bin
commands.-fc: all the file counts in your bin container.
commands.-dc: all the folder count in your bin container.
commands.-u: all the untracked fils not pushed to your bin conatiner.
commands.-x: all the excutables in your bin conatiner.

push.description: psuhes all the files added to the stgaing area to the bin container.

drop.description: drop certaine files or folders from the bin conatiner.

drops everything n your bin container from folders to files or other items container in the bin container.
commands.<file || folder>: delete a certain file or folder in the bin container.
commands.-d: delete entire bin container or refresh

--help.description: Displays the manual page of all the commands used in bin cli and the what the commands and most commonly used commands.
